Umineko Project (UP): .........The eerie sound of the wind and rain.
Steam (ST): ...I could hear the eerie sound of wind and rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The eerie sound of the wind and rain.
PC Japanese (JP): ………不気味な雨と、風の音。
Russian (RU): ......Жуткий шум ветра и дождя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........O ominoso som do vento e da chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………陰氣森森的雨聲、風聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………阴气森森的雨声、风声。

Umineko Project (UP): Once again, I hazily regained consciousness on top of the bed...
Steam (ST): Once again, I hazily regained consciousness on top of the bed...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Once again, I hazily regained consciousness on top of the bed...
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はぼんやりと再び、ベッドの上で意識を取り戻す…。
Russian (RU): Я снова в тумане очнулся на кровати...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Deitado sobre a cama, mais uma vez, vagamente fui recobrando consciência...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我又一次於床上，朦朦朧朧恢復了意識…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我又一次于床上，朦朦胧胧恢复了意识…。

Umineko Project (UP): The finger that the witch had bitten off......was still attached.
Steam (ST): The finger that the witch had bitten off... was attached to my hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The finger that the witch had bitten off.....was still attached.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女に食い千切られた指は、……くっ付いてる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 魔女に食い千切られた指は、……くっ付いてる。
Russian (RU): Палец, откушенный ведьмой...... всё ещё был на месте.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O dedo que a bruxa havia mordido......ainda estava em seu lugar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被魔女咬斷的手指，……還連在手上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被魔女咬断的手指，……还连在手上。

Umineko Project (UP): I didn't say "it was all an illusion"......just that it was still attached.
Steam (ST): That's not to say that "it was all an illusion", but my finger was now attached.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't say 'it was all an illusion'......just that it was still attached.
PC Japanese (JP): あれは幻だった、ではなく、……くっ付いてると、表現する。
Russian (RU): Я не говорю 'это была иллюзия'...... только то, что он по‐прежнему у меня был.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não diria que "foi tudo uma ilusão"......só porque ele permaneceu onde deveria estar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那並非是一場幻覺，……所以用“還連在手上”一詞來表達。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那并非是一场幻觉，……所以用“还连在手上”一词来表达。

Umineko Project (UP): ...After all, the pain and the teeth marks as though a witch had bitten it.........were still there.
Steam (ST): ...After all, the pain and the teeth marks as though a witch had bitten it... ...were still there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …なぜなら、魔女に噛まれたかのような歯型と痛みが、……残っていたから。
Russian (RU): ...В конце концов, боль и следы от зубов, будто ведьма укусила его...... никуда не пропали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Afinal, a dor e as marcas dos dentes da bruxa que o morderam.........ainda estavam ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …要問為什麼的話，是因為宛如被魔女咬過似的齒痕與痛楚，……還在我的手指上殘留著，
Chinese Simplified (CN): …要问为什么的话，是因为宛如被魔女咬过似的齿痕与痛楚，……还在我的手指上残留着，

Umineko Project (UP): And yet, the window, which I had supposedly smashed, had been fixed as though it had never been broken in the first place...
Steam (ST): And yet, the window, which I had supposedly smashed, had been fixed as though it had never been broken in the first place...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And yet, the window, which I had supposedly smashed, had been fixed as though it had never been broken in the first place...
PC Japanese (JP): なのに叩き割ったはずの窓ガラスは、最初からそうだったかのように平然と直っている…。
Russian (RU): И тем не менее, окно, которое я разбил, было как новым, словно его и вовсе не разбивали...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E ainda, a janela que eu supostamente havia quebrado, estava inteira, como se nunca tivesse sido quebrada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，理應已被敲碎了的窗玻璃，卻如一開始即是那樣般地恢復了原狀…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，理应已被敲碎了的窗玻璃，却如一开始即是那样般地恢复了原状…。

Umineko Project (UP): .........How can I escape this creepy room?
Steam (ST): ......How can I escape from this creepy room?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........How can I escape this creepy room?
PC Japanese (JP): ………俺は、どうすればこの気味の悪い部屋から逃げられるんだ。
Russian (RU): .........Как мне выбраться из этой жуткой комнаты?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Como eu posso escapar deste quarto estranho?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………我要怎麼做，才能從這令人心裡發毛的房間逃出去啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………我要怎么做，才能从这令人心里发毛的房间逃出去啊。

Umineko Project (UP): Why am I locked up in this eerie room......all alone...?
Steam (ST): Why am I locked up in this eerie room...all alone...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Why am I locked up in this eerie room......all alone...?
PC Japanese (JP): どうして俺だけが、……こんな不気味な部屋に閉じ込められているんだ…。
Russian (RU): Почему я заперт в ней...... совсем один?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por que eu estou preso neste quarto sinistro......sozinho...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為什麼偏偏就我一個，……被關在了這種陰森的房間…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为什么偏偏就我一个，……被关在了这种阴森的房间…。

Umineko Project (UP): I want to get out. ......I have to get out. ......Let me out of here.........
Steam (ST): I want to get out. ...I have to get out. ...Please, let me out......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 出たい。……出なくちゃ。……ここから出して………。
Russian (RU): Я хочу выйти. ......Мне нужно выйти. ......Выпустите меня отсюда.........
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu quero sair. ......Eu preciso sair. ......Me deixe sair daqui.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 好想出去。……我得出去。……放我出去吧………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): ......The door was sealed with a firm chain.
Steam (ST): ...The door was sealed with a firm chain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……扉は厳重な鎖によって封じられている。
Russian (RU): ......Дверь была перекрыта твёрдой цепью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A porta estava selada com uma firme corrente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……門被誇張的鎖鏈所封住。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……门被夸张的锁链所封住。

Umineko Project (UP): I could open it a crack, but only enough to peek out into the corridor at best.
Steam (ST): I could open it a crack, but only enough to peek out into the corridor at best.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I could open it a crack, but only enough to peek out into the corridor at best.
PC Japanese (JP): わずかの隙間は許されるが、せいぜい廊下を覗き見られる程度。
Russian (RU): Я мог открыть в ней лишь щель, в лучшем случае достаточную, чтобы выглянуть в коридор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu consegui abrir uma fresta nela, mas não serviu para nada mais além de espiar o corredor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖能稍微打開一條縫，但充其量只是能窺視下走廊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽能稍微打开一条缝，但充其量只是能窥视下走廊。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It would probably be hard even to get just a fist through it.
Steam (ST): Even getting just a fist through it would probably be hard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It would probably be hard even to get just a fist through it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……握り拳ひとつさえ、通すのは難しいだろう。
Russian (RU): Через неё даже сложно просунуть руку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Provavelmente seria difícil até mesmo fazer um punho passar por ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……就連握緊的拳頭，都很難通過吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……就连握紧的拳头，都很难通过吧。

Umineko Project (UP): The windows wouldn't budge either.{n}They were no better than barred prison windows...
Steam (ST): The window wouldn't budge either. It was no better than a barred prison window...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The window won't budge either. It was no better than a barred prison window...
PC Japanese (JP): 窓も、びくともしない。鉄格子の入った、監獄の窓も同然だった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 窓も、びくともしない。{n}鉄格子の入った、監獄の窓も同然だった…。
Russian (RU): Окно тоже не шелохнётся.{n}Ничем не лучше окна в тюремной камере...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As janelas não se mexiam um centímetro.{n}Não eram diferentes das janelas de uma cela...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 窗戶也是，堅實得紋絲不動。{n}簡直等同於，用鐵條制成的監獄鐵窗…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 窗户也是，坚实得纹丝不动。{n}简直等同于，用铁条制成的监狱铁窗…。

Umineko Project (UP): The bathroom didn't even have a window.
Steam (ST): The bathroom didn't even have a window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The bathroom didn't even have a window.
PC Japanese (JP): 風呂場は、その窓さえない。
Russian (RU): В ванной окон вообще не было.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O banheiro sequer tinha alguma abertura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 浴室裡，連窗戶都沒有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 浴室里，连窗户都没有。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The only thing that could get out through there was the water that flowed out if you turned on the tap.
Steam (ST): ...The only thing that could get out of there...was the water that flowed out if you turned on the tap.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The only thing that could get out of there was the water that flowed out if you turned on the tap.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そこから出られるのは、蛇口を捻って溢れ出す流水だけだ。
Russian (RU): ......Оттуда могла выйти только вода, текущая, если повернуть кран.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A única coisa que podia escapar daqui era a água que descia pelo encanamento quando você abria a torneira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……能從那出去的，僅限擰開水龍頭所噴出的流水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……能从那出去的，仅限拧开水龙头所喷出的流水。

Umineko Project (UP): ......No matter how hard I tried, ......I couldn't think of any way out of here.
Steam (ST): ...No matter what I do, ...I can't think of a way out of here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......No matter what I do, ......I can't think of a way out of here.
PC Japanese (JP): ……どうやっても、……ここを出られる方法が思いつかない。
Russian (RU): ......Что бы я ни делал...... у меня не получается придумать способ выбраться отсюда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não importa o quanto me esforce, ......eu não consigo pensar em nenhuma forma de sair daqui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不管怎麼做都想不出，……能從這出去的方法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不管怎么做都想不出，……能从这出去的方法。

Umineko Project (UP): Shut in here like this, I was no more or less than a prisoner.
Steam (ST): While shut up in a place like this, I truly am a prisoner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Being shut up in a place like this makes me a true prisoner.
PC Japanese (JP): ここに閉じ込められている自分は、まさに虜。
Russian (RU): То, что я заперт здесь, делает меня настоящим пленником.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Preso em um lugar como esse, eu não sou diferente de um simples prisioneiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被關在這裡的自己，整個就是一俘虜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被关在这里的自己，整个就是一俘虏。

Umineko Project (UP): Unless someone came from outside to save me, ......I wouldn't be able to get out for all eternity.
Steam (ST): Unless someone comes from outside to save me, ...I won't be able to get out for all eternity.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Unless someone comes from outside to save me, ......I won't be able to get out for all eternity.
PC Japanese (JP): 誰かが外から助けてくれない限り、……ここを永遠に出られはしないのだ。
Russian (RU): Если меня не придут спасти...... я никогда не смогу выйти отсюда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A não ser que alguém de fora venha para me salvar, ......eu ficarei preso aqui por toda a eternidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 除非有誰從外面前來搭救，……否則永遠都沒法從這出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 除非有谁从外面前来搭救，……否则永远都没法从这出去。

Umineko Project (UP): .........In that case, couldn't I just call for help?
Steam (ST): ......In that case, can't I just call for help?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........In that case, can't I just call for help?
PC Japanese (JP): ………なら、助けを呼べばいいのでは。
Russian (RU): .........Тогда почему бы мне не позвать на помощь?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Sendo assim, eu não poderia pedir por ajuda?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………那麼，去喊人來救我出去不就行了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………那么，去喊人来救我出去不就行了。

Umineko Project (UP): Yes, the tiny gap I could make in that door had to exist so that I could call for help.
Steam (ST): Yes, the tiny gap I can make in that door must exist so that I can call for help.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Yes, the tiny gap I can make in that door must exist so that I can call for help.
PC Japanese (JP): そう、あの扉に出来るわずかの隙間はやはり、助けを呼ぶためのものなのだ。
Russian (RU): Да, я могу открыть в двери крошечную щель для этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, a pequena fresta que consigo abrir na porta pode servir para eu chamar por ajuda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，那扇門所能打開的一絲絲縫隙，果然是為喊人幫忙而留著的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，那扇门所能打开的一丝丝缝隙，果然是为喊人帮忙而留着的。

Umineko Project (UP): But......could I make the words come out...?
Steam (ST): But...can I make the words come out...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But......can I make the words come out...?
PC Japanese (JP): でも、……口から言葉は、出せるだろうか…？
Russian (RU): Но...... как мне сказать?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas......como vou fazer para as palavras saírem...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，……從我的嘴巴，能蹦出話來嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，……从我的嘴巴，能蹦出话来吗…？

Umineko Project (UP): I had tried to call out for help before, but for some reason, the words couldn't escape my mouth.
Steam (ST): Earlier, I tried to call out for help, but for some reason, the words couldn't escape my mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Earlier, I tried to call out for help, but for some reason, the words couldn't escape my mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): 前にも、ここから助けを求めようとしたが、なぜか俺の口から言葉を出すことは出来なかった。
Russian (RU): Ранее я пытался позвать на помощь, но почему‐то слова не вышли из моего рта.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu já tentei chamar por ajuda antes, mas, por algum motivo, as palavras não vertiam pela minha boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之前，我也有嘗試過從門縫喊人來幫忙，但不知為何從我的嘴巴，就是喊不出話來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之前，我也有尝试过从门缝喊人来帮忙，但不知为何从我的嘴巴，就是喊不出话来。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I might have made some kind of mistake.
Steam (ST): ...Maybe I was just confused.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……何かの、間違いかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ......Я мог что‐то неправильно понять.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Talvez eu tivesse me confundido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……也許，是哪搞錯了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……也许，是哪搞错了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): I might have just lost my voice in my haste and confusion.
Steam (ST): I might've lost my voice in my haste and confusion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I might have just lost my voice in my haste and confusion.
PC Japanese (JP): 焦って混乱していたので、声がかすれてしまっただけかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Может, я просто потерял голос в спешке и растерянности?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu posso ter perdido a voz por causa da minha apreensão e confusão naquela hora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 或許僅僅是因急得心亂如麻，而語未成聲也說不定。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 或许仅仅是因急得心乱如麻，而语未成声也说不定。

Umineko Project (UP): I cracked the door open one more time.
Steam (ST): I'll open the door and make that crack appear one more time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'll open the door and make that crack appear one more time.
PC Japanese (JP): もう一度、扉を開けて隙間を作る。
Russian (RU): Открою ещё раз щель в двери.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu abri uma fresta na porta de novo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我再一次地將門推開了一條縫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我再一次地将门推开了一条缝。

Umineko Project (UP): The warm light of the hallway flowed in, making the darkness of the room stand out all the more...
Steam (ST): The warm light of the hallway flowed in, making the darkness of the room stand out all the more...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The warm light of the hallway flowed in, making the darkness of the room stand out all the more...
PC Japanese (JP): 温かな廊下の明かりが漏れ、一層、部屋の闇を引き立たせる…。
Russian (RU): Из коридора лился тёплый свет, всё больше выделяя темноту комнаты...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A calorosa luz do corredor inundou o quarto, fazendo com que a escuridão do mesmo se afastasse de uma vez só...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走廊上的溫暖亮光漏入室內，更進一步地襯托出了房中的陰暗…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走廊上的温暖亮光漏入室内，更进一步地衬托出了房中的阴暗…。

Umineko Project (UP): Though I couldn't hear any voices, I did feel something peaceful.
Steam (ST): Though I couldn't hear any voices, I did feel something peaceful.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though I couldn't hear any voices, I did feel something peaceful.
PC Japanese (JP): 声は聞こえずとも、やはり和やかな気配が感じられる。
Russian (RU): Я не слышал голосов, но чувствовал нечто мирное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora não conseguisse ouvir vozes, eu pude sentir uma certa tranquilidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖並未聽到聲音，但果然是能感到和樂融融的歡快氣息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽并未听到声音，但果然是能感到和乐融融的欢快气息。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I was sure that everyone was in a room at the other end of the hallway, chatting happily about something.
Steam (ST): ...I'm sure everyone's in the room at the other end of the hallway, chatting happily about something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I'm sure everyone's in the room at the other end of the hallway, chatting happily about something.
PC Japanese (JP): ……廊下の向こうの部屋にきっとみんながいて、楽しそうに談笑してるに違いないのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Наверняка все радостно болтают о чём‐то в комнате на другом конце коридора.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Certamente todos estavam em um quarto ao final do corredor, conversando alegremente sobre algum assunto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大家肯定是正在走廊對面的房間裡，開心談笑著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大家肯定是正在走廊对面的房间里，开心谈笑着。

Umineko Project (UP): If I could just call out, someone would surely come to save me......
Steam (ST): If I can just call out, surely someone will come to save me...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I can just call out, surely someone will come to save me......
PC Japanese (JP): 声さえ出せれば、きっと誰かが助けに来てくれる……。
Russian (RU): Если я смогу позвать на помощь, меня обязательно придут спасти......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu conseguisse gritar, alguém certamente viria me salvar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只要能喊出聲，就一定會有人來救我的……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只要能喊出声，就一定会有人来救我的……。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Holding back some indescribable fear, I tried yelling once more...
Steam (ST): Holding back some indescribable fear, I tried yelling once more...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 形容し難い、何かの恐怖感に耐えつつ、再び大きな声を出そうと試みる…。
Russian (RU): Сдерживая неописуемый страх, я попытался закричать ещё раз...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com um sentimento de medo difícil de descrever, eu tentei gritar mais uma vez...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我邊忍耐著難以形容的莫名恐懼，邊再次嘗試大聲喊叫…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我边忍耐着难以形容的莫名恐惧，边再次尝试大声喊叫…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): But the result was the same.
Steam (ST): But the result was the same.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): だが、結果は同じ。
Russian (RU): Но результат был тем же.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o resultado foi o mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，結果一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，结果一样。

Umineko Project (UP): It was like trying to yell underwater. ......All I did was get out of breath, unable to call out in the slightest.
Steam (ST): It was like trying to yell underwater. ...All I did was get out of breath, unable to call out in the slightest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was like trying to yell underwater. ......All I did was get out of breath, unable to call out in the slightest.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで水の中で叫ぼうとしているが如く、……息苦しくなるだけで、何も声を出すことが出来ない。
Russian (RU): Словно попытки кричать под водой. ......Я лишь задыхался, не в состоянии позвать на помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era como gritar debaixo d'água. ......Tudo o que fiz foi ficar sem ar, incapaz de emitir qualquer ruído.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如同想在水中喊叫一般，……只是在令自己透不過氣來，什麼聲音都沒發出來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如同想在水中喊叫一般，……只是在令自己透不过气来，什么声音都没发出来。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Even though I could say as much as I wanted if I just grumbled to myself inside the room, ......whenever I tried to make my voice reach outside, I choked and was unable to say anything.
Steam (ST): Even though I could say as much as I wanted if I just grumbled to myself inside the room, ...whenever I tried to make my voice reach outside, I choked and was unable to say anything.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 室内で独り言を愚痴るだけなら、いくらでも喋れるのに、……外に声を伝えようとすると、何も喋ることが出来ず、窒息する。
Russian (RU): Я мог говорить сколько угодно, ворча себе под нос в комнате...... но всякий раз, пытаясь сделать так, чтобы мой голос вышел за её пределы, я задыхался и ничего не мог сказать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo conseguido dizer o que eu quisesse enquanto eu resmungava comigo mesmo dentro do quarto, ......sempre que eu tentava fazer com que minha voz alcançasse o outro lado, eu sufocava e não conseguia dizer nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 光是在室內自言自語發牢騷的話，明明是想講多少就能講多少，……可一到了想把聲音傳到外面，就什麼都講不出來，直接窒息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 光是在室内自言自语发牢骚的话，明明是想讲多少就能讲多少，……可一到了想把声音传到外面，就什么都讲不出来，直接窒息。

Umineko Project (UP): I understood.
Steam (ST): I understand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I understand.
PC Japanese (JP): 理解する。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entendi.

Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): ......My body wasn't the only thing imprisoned in this eerie locked room.
Steam (ST): ...My body isn't the only thing locked up in this eerie closed room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......My body isn't the only thing locked up in this eerie closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……この不気味な密室に閉じ込められているのは、俺の体だけじゃない。
Russian (RU): ......Не только я сам заперт в этой жуткой закрытой комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Meu corpo não é a única coisa aprisionada dentro deste quarto sinistro.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……被关在这间阴森森的密室里的，并不仅仅只是我的身体。

Umineko Project (UP): ......My voice was, as well......
Steam (ST): ...My voice is too...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......My voice is too......
PC Japanese (JP): ……声もなんだ……。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A minha voz também......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……還包括了我的聲音……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……还包括了我的声音……。

Umineko Project (UP): Thinking that I could use some other kind of sound to call for help, I tried opening and closing the door violently, making the chain rattle.
Steam (ST): Thinking that I could use some other kind of sound to call for help, I tried opening and closing the door violently, making the chain rattle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thinking that I could use some other kind of sound to call for help, I tried opening and closing the door violently, making the chain rattle.
PC Japanese (JP): 声が駄目なら、音で呼べないかと思い、扉を激しく開け閉めして鎖を鳴らしてみた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pensando em chamar por ajuda reproduzindo algum outro som, eu tentei abrir e fechar a porta violentamente, fazendo a corrente sacudir.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 想到既然我的声音不行，那是不是能用别的响声来喊人呢，我快速开关起了门想将锁链弄出声响。

Umineko Project (UP): It did sound as though it was making a noisy clanking sound, ......but I was sure it was no good.
Steam (ST): It does sound as though it's clanking noisily, ...but it's surely no good.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It does sound as though it's making a noisy clanking sound, ......but it's surely no good.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かにそれはガシャガシャと賑やかな音を立てているように聞こえたが、……きっと無駄なのだ。
Russian (RU): Да, это вызывало шумный звон...... но ничуть не помогло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela reproduzia um som equivalente a um tinido, ......mas não era o suficiente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖確實能聽到它發出的“咔嗄咔嗄”的吵鬧響聲，……但一定是白費工夫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽确实能听到它发出的“咔嗄咔嗄”的吵闹响声，……但一定是白费工夫。

Umineko Project (UP): Even this sound......was imprisoned within the locked room.
Steam (ST): Even this sound...is being locked inside this closed room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even this sound......is being locked inside this closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): この音もまた、……この密室に閉じ込められているのだ。
Russian (RU): Даже такой грохот...... заперт внутри этой закрытой комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até mesmo esse som......estava aprisionado dentro do quarto fechado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個響聲，……也亦是被關在了這個密室之中了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个响声，……也亦是被关在了这个密室之中了。

Umineko Project (UP): No matter how harsh a sound I made, ......I was certain it would be quieter than a leaf falling by the time it reached the other end of the corridor......
Steam (ST): No matter how harsh a sound I make, ...I'm sure it'll be quieter than a leaf falling by the time it reaches the other end of the corridor...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how harsh a sound I make, ......I'm sure it'll be quieter than a leaf falling by the time it reaches the other end of the corridor......
PC Japanese (JP): どんなに激しい音を立てても、……きっと廊下の向こうには、木の葉が落ちる音程度にも、聞こえていまい……。
Russian (RU): Каким бы звук ни был резким...... я уверен, он будет тише, чем от листа, упавшего на другом конце коридора......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa que tipo de som eu faça, ......no momento em que alcançar o final do corredor ele provavelmente vai ser mais silencioso que uma folha caindo no chão......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不管搞出多麼劇烈的聲響，……在走廊對面，連樹葉落地程度的聲音，都聽不到……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不管搞出多么剧烈的声响，……在走廊对面，连树叶落地程度的声音，都听不到……。

Umineko Project (UP): I tried using the hateful chain that sealed the door to make a sound to call for someone, but that only deepened my despair...
Steam (ST): I tried using the hateful chain that sealed the door to make a sound to call for someone, but that only deepened my despair...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I tried using the hateful chain that sealed the door to make a sound to call for someone, but that only deepened my despair...
PC Japanese (JP): この扉を閉ざす憎々しい鎖に音を立てさせて、それによって誰かを呼ぶ試みもまた、一層の絶望を掻き立てるだけだった…。
Russian (RU): Чтобы позвать на помощь, я гремел ненавистной цепочкой, запирающей дверь, но это только усугубило моё отчаяние...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tentei usar essa odiosa corrente que selava o quarto para fazer algum barulho que pudesse ser ouvido, mas isso só acabou aprofundando o meu desespero...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 想以將封住門的可恨鎖鏈弄出聲響，來引起誰的注意的嘗試，又只是更進一步地煽動著絕望…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 想以将封住门的可恨锁链弄出声响，来引起谁的注意的尝试，又只是更进一步地煽动着绝望…。

Umineko Project (UP): That's insane...
Steam (ST): That's insane...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): そんな馬鹿な…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso é loucura...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 怎麼可能…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 怎么可能…。

Umineko Project (UP): Even though just a second ago, it was a stiff chain that looked like it was used to seal a monster away......
Steam (ST): Just a second ago, it was a stiff chain that looked like it might be used to seal a monster away...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though just a second ago, it was a stiff chain that looked like it was used to seal a monster away......
PC Japanese (JP): ついさっきまで、まるで化け物を封印するかのような厳しい鎖だったはずなのに……。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明直到刚才，那还是条简直就像是在封印妖怪般的夸张锁链……。

Umineko Project (UP): This changed everything.{n}Now I could just undo it from the inside...!
Steam (ST): This changes everything. Now I can just undo it from the inside...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This changes everything. Now I can just undo it from the inside...!
PC Japanese (JP): これなら、話はまるで違う。内側から、普通に開けることが出来る…！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): これなら、話はまるで違う。{n}内側から、普通に開けることが出来る…！

Umineko Project (UP): I tried to undo the chain, but I couldn't pull it off, the chain not being long enough for that while the door was still open a crack. Of course.
Steam (ST): I tried to undo it, but the chain wasn't long enough for that while the door was still open a crack, and I couldn't get it off. Obviously.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I tried to undo it, but the chain wasn't long enough for that while the door was still open a crack, and I couldn't get it off. Of course.

Steam (ST): I gulped...and calmly closed the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I gulped, ......and calmly closed the door.

Steam (ST): Then, ...when I saw that the chain had slackened enough, ...I touched it with my finger to make sure.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, ......when I saw that the chain had slackened enough, ...I touched it with my finger to make sure.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ......assim que vi que a corrente havia afrouxado o suficiente, ...eu a toquei com meu dedo para ter certeza.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，……在看到门链放得够松后，…我又用手指摸了下来确认了这一点。

Steam (ST): ...When I was little, ...I hated chains, because I could never get them undone right.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quando criança, ......eu sempre odiei correntes assim porque nunca conseguia abri‐las.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……小时候的我，做不到得心应手地打开链条锁，……最讨厌它了。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ......that was a long time ago.{n}I could unfasten them normally now.{n}......Anyone could... It was easy...
Steam (ST): However, ...that was a long time ago. Now, I can undo something like this. ...Anyone could, ...it's easy...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ......that was a long time ago. Now, I can undo something like this. ......Anyone could...it's easy...

Umineko Project (UP): At that moment, that terrible thought, that the demon who had locked me in this room might have been using this as a trap to give me hope and then make me despair even more, ......finally stopped haunting me.
Steam (ST): I imagined the demon who'd locked me in this room using this as a trap to give me hope, just to make me despair even more, ...but I pushed those thoughts aside for the time being.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I had a vision of the demon who had locked me in this room using this as a trap to give me hope and then make me despair even more, ......but I pushed those thoughts aside for the time being.
PC Japanese (JP): この部屋に俺を閉じ込めた悪魔が、もうすぐ出られると思わせて絶望させようと企む罠かもしれないという妄想は、……今、払われた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この部屋に俺を閉じ込めた悪魔が、もうすぐ出られると思わせて絶望させようと企む罠かもしれないという妄想は、……今、払われた。
Russian (RU): Мне показалось, что демон, который запер меня в этой комнате, устроил ловушку, чтобы дать мне надежду, а потом погрузить меня в ещё большее отчаяние...... но я пока прогнал эти мысли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse momento, um pensamento horrível me veio à mente, que o demônio que me trancou aqui poderia estar usando isso como uma armadilha para me deixar esperançoso e depois esmagar essa esperança, ......finalmente havia parado de me assombrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 關於“那搞不好是將我關進這間房間的惡魔，圖謀先令我以為馬上就能出去，然後再令我陷入絕望的圈套”的妄想，……於此刻，煙消雲散。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 关于“那搞不好是将我关进这间房间的恶魔，图谋先令我以为马上就能出去，然后再令我陷入绝望的圈套”的妄想，……于此刻，烟消云散。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Please, ......don't torment me anymore......and just.........open normally......!

PC Japanese (JP): チェーンを外すために一度扉を閉めたから。……廊下の温かな明かりは断絶されている。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu precisava fechar a porta para conseguir tirar a corrente, ......então a calorosa luz do corredor foi cortada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於剛才為取下門鏈而關上了門。……所以，室內完全隔絕了走廊上的溫暖燈光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于刚才为取下门链而关上了门。……所以，室内完全隔绝了走廊上的温暖灯光。

Umineko Project (UP): What if......I opened it again and that warm light was gone this time? ......I was even afraid of that.
Steam (ST): If I open it again, what if that warm light is gone this time? ...I was even afraid of stuff like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I open it again, what if that warm light is gone this time? ......I was even afraid of that.
PC Japanese (JP): もし、……再び開けたら、今度は廊下からその温かさが失われていないだろうか。……そんなことにさえ怯えた。
Russian (RU): Если я снова её открою, вдруг этот свет исчезнет?......Я боялся даже этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E se......a luz tiver desaparecido quando eu abri‐la novamente? ......Eu estava com medo disso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果，……我去重新將門打開，那這次走廊會不會就失去了那份溫暖氛圍呢？……我甚至都還怕起了這個。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果，……我去重新将门打开，那这次走廊会不会就失去了那份温暖氛围呢？……我甚至都还怕起了这个。

Umineko Project (UP): However, that was..................just me over‐imagining things.
Steam (ST): However, that was...... ...just me over-imagining things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, that was...............just me over-imagining things.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それは…………、……思い過ごし。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、それは…………、……思い過ごし。
Russian (RU): Но это............ просто моё воображение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas isso não..................passava da minha imaginação exagerada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這就…………，……想太多了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这就…………，……想太多了。

Umineko Project (UP): Slowly, ......expanding before my eyes, ...no, this is normal for a door......
Steam (ST): Slowly, ...quickly...... no, I guess this is normal for a door...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Slowly, ......quickly, ..no, I guess this is normal for a door......
PC Japanese (JP): ゆっくり、……みるみる、…いや、これは扉なら当たり前……。
Russian (RU): Медленно...... быстро, ...нет, думаю, нормально для двери......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Lentamente, ......expandindo‐se diante dos meus olhos, ...não, isso é normal para uma porta......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 門緩緩地，……眼瞧著就，…不，既然它是扇門，那這就是理所當然的事……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 门缓缓地，……眼瞧着就，…不，既然它是扇门，那这就是理所当然的事……。

Umineko Project (UP): As the door let out an annoying creak, .........the exit from this cursed locked room finally opened......
Steam (ST): As the door let out an annoying creak, ......the exit from this cursed closed room finally opened...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the door let out an annoying creak, .........the exit from this cursed closed room finally opened......
PC Japanese (JP): 耳障りな軋みで鳴きながら、………この呪われた密室は、ようやくその出口を開く……。
Russian (RU): Дверь раздражающе заскрипела......... и выход из этой проклятой закрытой комнаты наконец открылся......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Conforme a porta foi emitindo um rangido irritante, .........a saída deste quarto fechado amaldiçoado finalmente foi se abrindo......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 伴隨著“嘎吱”的噪音，………這間受詛咒的密室，終於開啟了出口……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 伴随着“嘎吱”的噪音，………这间受诅咒的密室，终于开启了出口……。

Umineko Project (UP): Ha...hahaha, I did it......I did it......!
Steam (ST): Ha...hahaha, I did it...I did it...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ha...hahaha, I did it......I did it......!
PC Japanese (JP): は、ははは、やった、……やった……！
Russian (RU): Ха... ха‐ха‐ха, получилось...... получилось!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ha...hahaha, eu consegui......eu consegui......!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哈、哈哈哈，成功了，……成功了……！

Umineko Project (UP): Even my cry of joy was strangled.{n}......But that didn't matter anymore.{n}All that mattered was that I could get out!
Steam (ST): Even my cry of joy was strangled. ...But that doesn't matter anymore. All that matters is that I can get out!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even my cry of joy was strangled.......But that doesn't matter anymore. All that matters is that I can get out!
PC Japanese (JP): その喜びの声さえ、窒息させられてしまう。……でももう、そんなことはどうでもいい。ここから出られさえすれば！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その喜びの声さえ、窒息させられてしまう。{n}……でももう、そんなことはどうでもいい。{n}ここから出られさえすれば！
Russian (RU): Даже мой радостный крик был заглушён.{n}......Но какая теперь разница.{n}Мне удалось выбраться — вот что главное!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até mesmo meus gritos de alegria foram sufocados.{n}......Mas isso não importava mais.{n}Tudo o que importava era que eu poderia sair!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就連這喜悅之聲，都遭到了強制窒息。{n}……不過，這種事已經無所謂了。{n}只要能從這出去就行！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就连这喜悦之声，都遭到了强制窒息。{n}……不过，这种事已经无所谓了。{n}只要能从这出去就行！

Umineko Project (UP): I poked my head out and looked left and right down the corridor.
Steam (ST): I poked my head out and looked left and right down the corridor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): そっと首を出し、廊下の左右を窺う。
Russian (RU): Я высунул голову и осмотрелся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu coloquei minha cabeça para fora e olhei para ambos os lados do corredor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我探出頭去，窺視走廊左右。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我探出头去，窥视走廊左右。

Umineko Project (UP): The warm corridor. I can sense people having fun at the other end. ......Everyone's right there. Let's go, right now.
Steam (ST): The warm corridor. I could sense people having fun at the other end. ...Everyone's right there. Let's go, right now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The warm corridor. I could sense people having fun at the other end. ......Everyone's right there. Let's go, right now.
PC Japanese (JP): 温かな廊下。向こうの方から、楽しそうな気配を感じる。……みんな、向こうにいるんだ。行こう、早く。
Russian (RU): Тёплый коридор. Я чувствовал, что люди хорошо проводят время на другом конце. ......Все прямо там. Скорее туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O caloroso corredor. Eu consigo sentir as pessoas se divertindo ao final dele. ......Todos estão bem ali. Vamos lá agora mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從溫暖走廊的對面，感到了陣陣歡快的氣息。……大家，就在那邊呢。去那吧，快點。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从温暖走廊的对面，感到了阵阵欢快的气息。……大家，就在那边呢。去那吧，快点。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): At that moment, something cold and heartless crushed my throat.
Steam (ST): At that moment, something cold and heartless crushed my throat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): その時、冷たく無慈悲な何かが、俺の喉を潰した。
Russian (RU): Горло вдруг сдавило нечто холодное и безжалостное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse instante, algo frio e impiedoso esmagou minha garganta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此時，冰冷無情的某物，掐住了我的咽喉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此时，冰冷无情的某物，掐住了我的咽喉。

Umineko Project (UP): It was as though an iron loop had been fastened around my neck and pulled on hard from behind.
Steam (ST): It was as though an iron loop had been fastened around my neck and pulled on hard from behind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was as though an iron loop had been fastened around my neck and pulled on hard from behind.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、鉄の輪が首に括りつけられていて、それを思い切り後ろから引っ張られたかのようだった。
Russian (RU): Как будто на шее оказалась железная петля и сильно потянула сзади.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi como se um anel de ferro tivesse se atado ao redor do meu pescoço e me puxado violentamente para trás.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直就像是，被铁圈套出脖子，被人发狠劲地往后拉似的。

Umineko Project (UP): No...not "as though".

Original Witch Hunt (OG): No...not 'as though'.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não...não foi "como se".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不是好像，
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): ......Without my knowing, ......at some point......a thick, metal collar had been fastened around my neck.
Steam (ST): ...Without my knowing, ...at some point, ...a thick, metal collar had been fastened around my neck.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Without my knowing, ......at some point.........a thick, metal collar had been fastened around my neck.
PC Japanese (JP): ……本当に、……いつの間にか俺の首に、……無骨な鉄の首輪が括りつけられているのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……本当に、……いつの間にか俺の首に、……無骨な鉄の首輪が括りつけられているのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Без моего ведома...... в какой‐то момент...... у меня на шее оказалась толстая металлическая петля.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sem que eu percebesse, ......em algum momento......uma espessa coleira de metal havia sido colocado ao redor do meu pescoço.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是真的。……我的脖子在不知不覺間，………被套在了粗獷的鐵項圈之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是真的。……我的脖子在不知不觉间，………被套在了粗犷的铁项圈之中。

Umineko Project (UP): When had this happened?! And when I turned around, I despaired even more.
Steam (ST): When did this happen?! When I turned around, I despaired even more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When did this happen?! When I turned around, I despaired even more.
PC Japanese (JP): こんなの、いつの間にッ？！　そして、振り返ってさらに絶望する。
Russian (RU): Когда?! Обернувшись, я отчаялся ещё больше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando isso aconteceu?! Assim que me virei, eu fiquei ainda mais desesperado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這玩意，是在什麼時候？！接著回頭一看，我更加地絕望了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这玩意，是在什么时候？！接着回头一看，我更加地绝望了。

Umineko Project (UP): From the inner side of the door I had just opened, ......a thick chain extended......which was connected to my collar.
Steam (ST): Out from the inner side of the door I had just opened, ...a thick chain had extended... and attached itself to this collar I was wearing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Out from the inner side of the door I had just opened, ......a thick chain had extended......and attached itself to my collar.
PC Japanese (JP): 今、開いたばかりの扉の内側から、……太い鎖が伸びていて、……俺のこの首輪に、繋がっているのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 今、開いたばかりの扉の内側から、……太い鎖が伸びていて、……俺のこの首輪に、繋がっているのだ。
Russian (RU): С внутренней стороны двери, открытой мной только что...... прямо к моему воротнику...... тянулась толстая цепь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado interior da porta que eu tinha acabado de abrir, ......uma grande e longa corrente......estava presa à minha coleira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此刻，從剛剛打開的門的內側，……多出了一根很粗的鎖鏈，……正連接著套住我脖子的項圈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此刻，从刚刚打开的门的内侧，……多出了一根很粗的锁链，……正连接着套住我脖子的项圈。

Umineko Project (UP): I pulled on it, but it didn't even budge.{n}When I shook it, the whole door creaked.
Steam (ST): I pulled on it, but it didn't even budge. When I shook it, the whole door creaked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I pulled on it, but it didn't even budge. When I shook it, the whole door creaked.
PC Japanese (JP): その鎖を引っ張るが、びくともしない。揺すると、扉ごとぎしぎしと鳴く。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その鎖を引っ張るが、びくともしない。{n}揺すると、扉ごとぎしぎしと鳴く。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tentei puxar essa corrente, mas ela sequer se mexeu.{n}Quando eu a sacudi, toda a porta rangeu.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我想扯下这根链子，纹丝不动。{n}左右乱摇晃着，连门都一起发出了“嘎吱嘎吱”的响声。

Steam (ST): ...What... ...th... ...the hell...

Umineko Project (UP): The chain that connected to my collar......was attached to the inner side of the door.
Steam (ST): The chain that connected to my collar...was attached to the inner side of the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The chain that connected to my collar......was attached to the inner side of the door.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺の首輪に繋がる鎖は、………扉の内側に、繋がっている。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A corrente conectada à minha coleira......estava presa ao lado interior da porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我項圈的鎖鏈，………連接著門的內側。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我项圈的锁链，………连接着门的内侧。

Umineko Project (UP): Yes. The same heartless chain that had secured the door a short while back...had suddenly become a chain holding {i:me} in place...
Steam (ST): Yes. The same vanishing chain that had secured the door a short while back...had suddenly become a chain holding me in place...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Yes. The same vanishing chain that had secured the door a short while back...had suddenly become a chain holding me in place...
PC Japanese (JP): そう。さっきまで扉を封じていたあの、無常な鎖が、いつの間にか俺を縛る鎖と変わっていたのだ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そう。さっきまで扉を封じていたあの、無情な鎖が、いつの間にか俺を縛る鎖と変わっていたのだ…。
Russian (RU): Да. Та исчезнувшая цепочка, недавно запиравшая дверь, вдруг стала цепью, удерживающей {i:меня}...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim. A mesma corrente impiedosa que estava trancando a porta até pouco tempo...de repente se tornou a corrente que estava {i:me} segurando...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 对。之前封住门的变幻无常之锁，在不知从何时起变化成了束缚住我的锁链…。

Umineko Project (UP): That's insane... That's insane...!!{n}Dammit, what's going on here?!!
Steam (ST): That's insane, ...that's insane...!! Dammit, what's going on here?!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's insane...that's insane...!! Dammit, what's going on here?!!

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そんな馬鹿な、そんな馬鹿な…！！{n}畜生、こんなことって、こんなことってッ！！

Chinese Simplified (CN): 怎么可能，怎么可能…！！{n}畜生，怎会这样，怎会这样！！

Umineko Project (UP): I pulled with all my strength, trying to tear the whole door off, but I already knew from repeated experiments that it wouldn't even budge.
Steam (ST): I pulled with all my strength, trying to tear the whole door off, but I already knew from repeated experiments that it wouldn't even budge.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Russian (RU): Я изо всех сил потянул её, пытаясь сорвать всю дверь, но из повторяющихся опытов мне уже было ясно, что она даже не шелохнётся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu a puxei com todas as forças, tentando arrancar ela da porta, mas as repetitivas tentativas de antes já me diziam que não se mexeria.

Steam (ST): ...I'm sure this chain will disappear once I go back inside the room. But it'll never let me leave that room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I'm sure this chain will disappear once I go back inside the room. But it will never let me leave the room.
PC Japanese (JP): ……きっとこの鎖は、俺が再び部屋に戻れば消えるのだ。しかし、部屋から出ることだけは、決して許さない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu estava certo que a corrente desapareceria no momento em que eu retornasse para o quarto.{n}Mas nunca iria me deixar sair.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這條鎖鏈，肯定是只要我重新回房間，即會自行消失。{n}不過，單單從這房間出去一事，它是絕對不會允許。

Umineko Project (UP): Though it had appeared to revert to being a normal chain lock, ......nothing had actually changed.

Steam (ST): Tears flowing down my face, I pulled with all I had. ...It was completely useless. No matter what I did, I'd never tear it loose.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Tears flowing down my face, I pulled with all I had.......It was completely useless. No matter what I did, I'd never tear it loose.
PC Japanese (JP): 涙をぼろぼろと零しながら、渾身の力で引っ張る。……無駄なことだ。どうやったって、千切れるわけがない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 涙をぼろぼろと零しながら、渾身の力で引っ張る。{n}……無駄なことだ。どうやったって、千切れるわけがない。
Russian (RU): Со стекающими по лицу слезами я с силой дёрнул цепь.{n}......Всё было совершенно напрасно. Что бы я ни делал, мне не разорвать её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Lágrimas começaram a escorrer pelo meu rosto enquanto eu puxava com todas as forças.{n}......Mas foi completamente inútil. Não importa o que eu tente, nunca serei capaz de rompê‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 眼淚大滴大滴地往下掉，我使出渾身力氣地拉扯鎖鏈。{n}……白費勁罷了。無論怎麼做，都沒可能扯得斷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 眼泪大滴大滴地往下掉，我使出浑身力气地拉扯锁链。{n}……白费劲罢了。无论怎么做，都没可能扯得断。

Umineko Project (UP): And I wasn't even permitted to call out for help.
Steam (ST): And I wasn't even permitted to call out for help.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And I wasn't even permitted to call out for help.
PC Japanese (JP): そして助けを呼ぶ声さえ許されない。
Russian (RU): И даже нельзя звать на помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E eu sequer podia pedir por ajuda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，連出聲喊人幫忙也不被允許。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，连出声喊人帮忙也不被允许。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I felt a confused anger at how the demon had mercilessly made me think for just an instant that I'd escaped.
Steam (ST): ...I felt a confused anger at how the demon had mercilessly made me think that I'd escaped for just an instant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I felt a confused anger at how the demon had mercilessly made me think that I'd escaped for just an instant.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ならば、部屋から出られたと一瞬だけ思わせる悪魔の無慈悲に、錯乱するような怒りを覚える。
Russian (RU): ......Я разозлился от того, как демон всего на мгновение безжалостно заставил меня подумать, что я спасён.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu senti uma fúria desordenada, pensando em como o demônio impiedosamente me fez pensar, por alguns instantes, que eu poderia escapar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……既然這樣，對於讓人一瞬間以為能從這房間出去的惡魔的狠毒，我爆發了如精神錯亂般的狂怒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……既然这样，对于让人一瞬间以为能从这房间出去的恶魔的狠毒，我爆发了如精神错乱般的狂怒。

Umineko Project (UP): But no matter how much I yelled, no voice came out, and no one on the other end of the corridor could hear me...
Steam (ST): But no matter how much I yelled, no voice came out, and no one on the other end of the corridor could hear me...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But no matter how much I yelled, no voice came out, and no one on the other end of the corridor could hear me...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし叫べども叫べども、それは声にはならず、廊下の向こうの誰の耳にも、届きはしない…。
Russian (RU): Но, сколько бы я ни кричал, голос не выходил, и на другом конце коридора меня никто не слышал...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa o quanto eu tente gritar, nenhuma voz sai, e ninguém que esteja do outro lado do corredor vai conseguir me ouvir...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，無論怎麼大叫大喊，這些喊叫皆是不會成聲，不會傳進走廊對面的任何人的耳朵…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，无论怎么大叫大喊，这些喊叫皆是不会成声，不会传进走廊对面的任何人的耳朵…。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, .........I noticed......an odd stain on the wall of the corridor.
Steam (ST): Then, ......I noticed... ...an odd stain on the wall of the corridor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, .........I noticed......an odd stain on the wall of the corridor.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、………廊下の壁に、……違和感のある汚れを見つけた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その時、………廊下の壁に、……違和感のある汚れを見つけた。
Russian (RU): Тогда......... я заметил...... странное пятно на стене коридора.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, .........eu percebi......uma mancha estranha na parede do corredor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在這時，………我從走廊的牆壁上，……發現了怪怪的污跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在这时，………我从走廊的墙壁上，……发现了怪怪的污迹。

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't a stain. ......They were letters, traced out by a finger that had been covered in red paint.
Steam (ST): It wasn't a stain. ...They were letters, traced out by a finger that had been covered in red paint.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It wasn't a stain. ......They were letters, traced out by a finger that had been covered in red paint.
PC Japanese (JP): 汚れじゃない。……それは、赤い塗料を塗った指でなぞったような、……文字だった。
Russian (RU): Нет, не пятно. ......Слова, написанные пальцем, измазанным в красной краске.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era uma mancha. ......Eram letras, desenhadas por um dedo coberto com tinta vermelha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，不是污跡。……那是，像是以沾著紅塗料的手指所寫下似的，……文字。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，不是污迹。……那是，像是以沾着红涂料的手指所写下似的，……文字。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Those letters, ......which looked like they had been drawn in blood, answered my biggest question...
Steam (ST): Those letters, ...which looked like they'd been drawn in blood, answered my biggest question...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those letters......which looked like they had been drawn in blood, answered my biggest question...
PC Japanese (JP): その、……血で書かれたような文字は、今の俺がもっとも知りたいことに答えてくれていた…。
Russian (RU): Эти слова...... выглядящие так, будто их написали кровью, ответили на мой главный вопрос...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas letras, ......que pareciam ter sido escritas à sangue, responderam a minha maior dúvida...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個，……仿彿是用血所寫成的文字，回答了此刻我最想知之事…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个，……仿佛是用血所写成的文字，回答了此刻我最想知之事…。

Umineko Project (UP): The chain lock must be set.{n}You may unset it, but it must then be reset.{n}Unless it is set, this exit of yours will be unusable.
Steam (ST): The chain lock must be set. {n}You're allowed to unset it, but it must then be reset. {n}Unless it is set, this exit of yours will be unusable.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The chain lock must be set.{n} You're allowed to unset it, but it must then be reset.{n} Unless it is set, this exit of yours will be unusable.
PC Japanese (JP): チェーンロックは閉じていなければならない。{n}開けても良いが、必ず閉じなければならない。{n}閉じなければお前の出口もまた、閉ざされる。
Russian (RU): Цепной замок должен быть заперт.{n}Его можно отпереть, но затем он должен быть заперт снова.{n}Пока он не заперт, тебе не уйти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A corrente precisa estar colocada.{n}Você pode removê‐la, mas ela deve ser recolocada.{n}A não ser que esteja colocada, você não será capaz de sair.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鏈條鎖必須鎖著。{n}可以開，但最終必須鎖著。{n}不去鎖好，你的出口也亦是會被關閉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 链条锁必须锁着。{n}可以开，但最终必须锁着。{n}不去锁好，你的出口也亦是会被关闭。

Umineko Project (UP): I instantly understood the meaning of that unsettling message.{n}Then I tried it out, and understood completely.
Steam (ST): I instantly understood the meaning of that ominous message. Then I tried it out, and understood completely.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I instantly understood the meaning of that ominous message. Then I tried it out, and understood completely.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はその不気味なメッセージの意味をすぐに理解する。そして実際に試し、完全に理解した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺はその不気味なメッセージの意味をすぐに理解する。{n}そして実際に試し、完全に理解した。
Russian (RU): Я сразу же понял смысл этого зловещего послания.{n}Я последовал ему и понял окончательно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu instantaneamente entendi o significado daquela mensagem aterradora.{n}Foi quando eu tentei, e então entendi por completo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我馬上就理解了這段陰森文字的意思。{n}接著實際試了下後，我徹底地理解了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我马上就理解了这段阴森文字的意思。{n}接着实际试了下后，我彻底地理解了。

Umineko Project (UP): When I return to the room and reset the chain lock, ......the binding around my neck disappears.
Steam (ST): When I returned to the room and reset the chain lock, ...the collar around my neck disappeared.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I returned to the room and reset the chain lock, ......the binding around my neck disappeared.
PC Japanese (JP): 部屋に戻り、チェーンロックを戻すと、……首輪の拘束は消えるのだ。
Russian (RU): Когда я вернулся в комнату и повесил цепочку...... оковы на шее исчезли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu coloquei novamente a corrente na porta ......a amarração ao redor do meu pescoço desapareceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 回到房中，重新鎖好鏈條鎖，……項圈的束縛當即消失。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 回到房中，重新锁好链条锁，……项圈的束缚当即消失。

Umineko Project (UP): When I undo the chain lock again, ......that heavy feeling around my neck returns.
Steam (ST): When I undid the chain lock again, ...that heavy feeling around my neck returned.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I undid the chain lock again, ......that heavy feeling around my neck returned.
PC Japanese (JP): チェーンロックを再び開けると、……再び首に、重みある感触が蘇る。
Russian (RU): Когда опять снял её...... ощущение тяжести на шее вернулось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu removi a corrente da porta mais uma vez, ......a pesada sensação ao redor do meu pescoço retornou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而再次打開鏈條鎖，……我便又重新感到，脖子上多出了那有點份量的玩意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而再次打开链条锁，……我便又重新感到，脖子上多出了那有点份量的玩意。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, I cannot escape this room while the chain lock is still unset.
Steam (ST): In other words, I cannot leave this room while the chain lock is still unset.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, I cannot leave this room while the chain lock is still unset.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、チェーンロックを開けたままでは、俺は部屋から出られないのだ。
Russian (RU): Пока цепочка не висит, мне не покинуть эту комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou seja, eu não poderia escapar deste quarto enquanto a corrente estivesse removida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總而言之，在打開鏈條鎖的情況下，我是無法從這房間出去的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总而言之，在打开链条锁的情况下，我是无法从这房间出去的。

Umineko Project (UP): But that means all I need to do is set the chain while outside the room...!
Steam (ST): In that case, why don't I just set the chain while outside the room...?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case, why don't I just set the chain while outside the room...?!
PC Japanese (JP): じゃあつまり、この部屋の外からチェーンを掛ければいいってことじゃないか…！
Russian (RU): Тогда почему бы не повесить её снаружи комнаты?!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas isso significa que tudo o que preciso fazer é recolocar a corrente quando eu estiver do lado de fora...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那麼這也就是說，只要能從外面掛好門鏈，不就行了嘛…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那么这也就是说，只要能从外面挂好门链，不就行了嘛…！

Umineko Project (UP): I undid the chain one more time.
Steam (ST): I undid the chain one more time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): もう一度チェーンを開ける。
Russian (RU): Я опять снял цепочку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu removi a corrente mais uma vez.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我再一次地取下門鏈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我再一次地取下门链。

Umineko Project (UP): The weighty collar and chain appeared around my neck again.
Steam (ST): The collar and chain appeared around my neck again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The collar and chain appeared around my neck again.
PC Japanese (JP): ずしりと、首に首輪と鎖が現れる。
Russian (RU): На шее снова появились ошейник и цепь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O peso do colar e da corrente apareceram mais uma vez ao redor do meu pescoço.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 脖子上，出現了連著鎖鏈的沉甸甸的項圈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 脖子上，出现了连着锁链的沉甸甸的项圈。

Umineko Project (UP): I stepped out into the corridor and closed the door behind me, leaving only the slightest of cracks.
Steam (ST): I stepped out into the corridor and closed the door behind me, leaving only the slightest of cracks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I stepped out into the corridor and closed the door behind me, leaving only the slightest of cracks.
PC Japanese (JP): そして廊下に出てすぐ扉を閉め、最小限の隙間を作る。
Russian (RU): Я вышел в коридор и закрыл за собой дверь, оставив только небольшую щель.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu dei um passo na direção do corredor e fechei a porta atrás de mim, deixando apenas uma pequena fresta aberta.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，我出门来到走廊上，将门关至仅留一条最小限度的缝隙。

Umineko Project (UP): I stuck my hand through that crack, grabbed the dangling chain, and tried to reset it somehow.
Steam (ST): I stuck my hand through that crack, grabbed the dangling chain, and tried to reset it somehow.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I stuck my hand through that crack, grabbed the dangling chain, and tried to reset it somehow.
PC Japanese (JP): そこから手を入れ、ぶらさがるチェーンを摘み、……何とか元通りに掛け直そうとする。
Russian (RU): Просунув в неё руку, я схватил свисающую цепочку и попробовал повесить её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enfiando minha mão por essa abertura, eu agarrei a corrente que estava pendurada e tentei dar um jeito de colocá‐la novamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將手伸進那條門縫，用手指夾起門鏈，……試圖將其照原樣重新掛好。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将手伸进那条门缝，用手指夹起门链，……试图将其照原样重新挂好。

Steam (ST): ...D-Dammit...
Russian (RU): ......Ч‐чёрт подери......

Umineko Project (UP): ......It's so easy to do from the inside.........so why......is it so hard to do from the outside...?
Steam (ST): ...Even though it was so easy to do from the inside, ...why... is it so hard to do from the outside...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though it was so easy to do from the inside.........why... is it so hard to do from the outside...?
PC Japanese (JP): ……内側からなら簡単に出来るのに、……何で、……外側からだとこうもうまく行かないんだよ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……内側からなら簡単に出来るのに、……何で、……外側からだとこうもうまく行かないんだよ…。
Russian (RU): ......Это было так легко сделать изнутри...... но почему... так трудно снаружи?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Por dentro é tão fácil.........então por que......é tão difícil pelo lado de fora...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……從內側明明能簡簡單單地就掛好，……可為什麼，……到了外面，就是那麼困難，無法順利掛上呢…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……从内侧明明能简简单单地就挂好，……可为什么，……到了外面，就是那么困难，无法顺利挂上呢…。

Umineko Project (UP): The gap needed to be wide if I wanted to manipulate the chain well.{n}However, that made the chain too short to reach.
Steam (ST): The gap needed to be wide if I wanted to manipulate the chain well. However, that made the chain too short to reach.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The gap needed to be wide if I wanted to manipulate the chain well. However, that made the chain too short to reach.
PC Japanese (JP): うまく作業をするには隙間が広いほうがいい。しかし隙間が広いとチェーンが短く、届かない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): うまく作業をするには隙間が広いほうがいい。{n}しかし隙間が広いとチェーンが短く、届かない。
Russian (RU): Чтобы хорошо управлять цепочкой, щель должна быть достаточно широкой.{n}Однако так цепочка становится слишком короткой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A abertura precisa ser larga se eu quiser manipular a corrente corretamente.{n}Mas isso faz com que a corrente fique pequena demais para se alcançar a outra ponta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要方便下手，那就得把門縫開大點。{n}可是開大了門縫，鏈條便會長度過短，掛不上去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要方便下手，那就得把门缝开大点。{n}可是开大了门缝，链条便会长度过短，挂不上去。

Umineko Project (UP): To bring the chain even close to reaching, I had to close the door as much as possible.
Steam (ST): To make the chain reach just a bit further, I'd have to close the door a little bit more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To make the chain reach just a bit further, I would have to close the door a little bit more.
PC Japanese (JP): チェーンが少しでも届くようにするには、扉を少しでも閉めなければならない。
Russian (RU): Чтобы удлинить её, нужно закрыть дверь ещё немного.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para aproximar a corrente o suficiente, eu precisava fechar a porta o máximo que fosse possível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為了盡可能地掛上鏈條，必須盡可能地關上門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为了尽可能地挂上链条，必须尽可能地关上门。

Umineko Project (UP): But doing that meant that there wouldn't be enough of a gap to fit my hand in.
Steam (ST): But if I do that, there won't even be enough of a gap to fit my hand in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But if I do that, there won't even be enough of a gap to fit my hand in.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそうすると手を入れる隙間さえ失われる。
Russian (RU): Но так я вообще не смогу просунуть туда руку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas fazer isso significaria não ter espaço o suficiente para enfiar a minha mão para dentro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是這麼做了，那就連伸進手去的縫隙都沒有了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是这么做了，那就连伸进手去的缝隙都没有了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Of course, that was perfectly natural.
Steam (ST): ...Of course, that was perfectly natural.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Of course, it was perfectly natural.
PC Japanese (JP): ……当然だ。
Russian (RU): ......Конечно, ничего удивительного.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sim, isso é algo normal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……當然的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……当然的事。

Umineko Project (UP): Chain locks are made to be done from the inside.
Steam (ST): Chain locks are made to be used from the inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Chain locks are made to be done from the inside.
PC Japanese (JP): チェーンロックは内鍵。
Russian (RU): Цепные замки сделаны так, чтобы отпираться изнутри.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Correntes de porta são feitas para serem fechadas por dentro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鏈條鎖是內鎖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 链条锁是内锁。

Umineko Project (UP): They'd be completely pointless if you could set and unset them from the outside.
Steam (ST): They'd be completely pointless if you could set and unset them from the outside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They'd be completely pointless if you could set and unset them from the outside.
PC Japanese (JP): 外から開け閉めが出来るようでは、その意味がまったくない。
Russian (RU): Они были бы абсолютно бесполезны, если бы их можно было отпереть и запереть извне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas seriam completamente inúteis se fosse possível abrir e fechar pelo lado de fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是能從室外開關的話，那它就完全沒意義了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是能从室外开关的话，那它就完全没意义了。

Umineko Project (UP): That's why the length of the chain is specially chosen...to prevent anyone from setting or unsetting it from the outside.
Steam (ST): That's why the length of the chain is specially chosen to prevent anyone from setting or unsetting it from the outside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's why the length of the chain is specially chosen to prevent anyone from setting or unsetting it from the outside.
PC Japanese (JP): だからチェーンの長さが絶妙に調整されていて、決して外からは開けることも閉めることも出来ないようになっているのだ。
Russian (RU): Вот почему длину цепочки специально подбирают так, чтобы её нельзя было повесить или сбросить снаружи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É por isso que o comprimento da corrente é definido com muito cuidado...para prevenir que qualquer um a coloque ou retire pelo lado exterior.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以鏈條的長度，是經過絕妙的調整，其構造本身即是絕對無法從室外上鎖、開鎖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以链条的长度，是经过绝妙的调整，其构造本身即是绝对无法从室外上锁、开锁。

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe I could manage it with some kind of hard and thin tool?
Steam (ST): Then, can I use some kind of hard and thin tool?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then can I use some kind of hard and thin tool?

Umineko Project (UP): Then, ......I noticed something weird.
Steam (ST): Then, ...I noticed something weird.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, ......I noticed something weird.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 此时，……我注意到了一异样之处。

Umineko Project (UP): I looked at my left hand, which I had pressed against the door to hold it in place, ......and between the fingers of that hand, ......I could see something red.
Steam (ST): I looked at my left hand, which I had pressed against the door to hold it in place, ...and between the fingers of that hand, ...I could see something red.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I looked at my left hand, which I had pressed against the door to hold it in place, ......and between the fingers of that hand, ......I could see something red.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu olhei para minha mão esquerda, que eu estava pressionando contra a porta para segurá‐la, ......e entre os dedos dessa mão, ......tinha alguma coisa vermelha.

Umineko Project (UP): "Since this game began, ......a large portion of the time has been spent on Shannon and Kanon's determination to fall in love. ......I have no problem with interpreting that as a story of growth and teenage determination for a girl and boy who call themselves furniture. PC Japanese (JP): ベアトはその話を聞きながら、魔法ってちょっぴり、おまじないに似てるなと思っていた。
Russian (RU): Слушая, Беато подумала, что магия напоминает талисман.

Umineko Project (UP): When most {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}s think of magic, they think of incredible miracles being performed one after another in front of a crowd.
Steam (ST): When most Humans think of magic, they think of incredible miracles being performed one after another in front of a crowd of other Humans.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When most humans think of magic, they think of incredible miracles being performed one after another in front of a crowd.
PC Japanese (JP): ニンゲンが考える魔法というのは、大勢のニンゲンの前で、まるで手品のように、すごい奇跡をポンポンと見せてくれるものだ。
Russian (RU): Рассуждая о магии, большинство {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ей представляют невероятные чудеса, исполняемые перед толпой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a grande maioria dos {y:0:Humanos}{n:0:humanos} pensam na magia, eles imaginam milagres inacreditáveis sendo conduzidos um após o outro diante de uma multidão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人類所想的魔法，乃是指在許許多多的人類面前宛如變魔術般，聲勢浩大地示出非同凡響的奇跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人类所想的魔法，乃是指在许许多多的人类面前宛如变魔术般，声势浩大地示出非同凡响的奇迹。

Umineko Project (UP): However, this true magic that the older sister spoke of sounded almost like a charm, something that had no effect if the person using it didn't believe.
Steam (ST): However, this true magic that the older sister spoke of sounded almost like a ritual, something that has no effect if the person using it doesn't believe.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, this true magic that the older sister spoke of sounded almost like a charm, something that had no effect if the person using it didn't believe.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、姉が語る本当の魔法とは、信じようとしない者には何の効果もない、まるでおまじないのようなものだった。
Russian (RU): Однако настоящая магия, о которой говорила старшая сестра, напоминала талисман — не действует, если человек не верит в неё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas essa magia verdadeira que sua irmã mais velha estava falando se parecia mais com um encantamento, algo que não teria efeito se a pessoa que estivesse utilizando não acreditasse.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，姐姐所讲的真正的魔法，却是对不信之人没有任何效果，恰似祈福之物。

Steam (ST): ...Shannon's heart was captured by George bit by bit as he grew by leaps and bounds.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O coração de Shannon foi capturado por George, pouco a pouco, conforme foi se transformando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對於年復一年，成長得都認不出來的讓治，紗音漸漸開始被他奪走了心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对于年复一年，成长得都认不出来的让治，纱音渐渐开始被他夺走了心。

Umineko Project (UP): However, she had given up, thinking that one of lower status such as herself would never find love with him.
Steam (ST): However, she had given up, thinking that one of a different class such as herself would never find love with him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, she had given up, thinking that one of a different class such as herself would never find love with him.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、身分の違う自分とは恋仲になれるわけがないと、諦めていた。
Russian (RU): Но она смирилась, считая, что, будучи из другого класса, никогда не сможет обрести с ним любовь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, ela desistiu, pensando que alguém inferior como ela nunca seria capaz de encontrar o amor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，她想到了讓治不可能與身份懸殊的自己成為一對戀人，而死了心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，她想到了让治不可能与身份悬殊的自己成为一对恋人，而死了心。

Umineko Project (UP): That was when {f:5:Beatrice} had given her the golden butterfly brooch and encouraged her.
Steam (ST): That was when {f:5:Beatrice} had given her the golden butterfly brooch and encouraged her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was when Beatrice had given her the golden butterfly brooch and encouraged her.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな彼女に、黄金蝶のブローチを与え、励ました。
Russian (RU): Именно тогда {f:5:Беатриче} воодушевила её, дав золотую брошь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi quando {f:5:Beatrice} deu a ela o broche da borboleta dourada e a encorajou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對這樣的她，魔女給予了黃金蝶別針，加以了鼓勵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对这样的她，魔女给予了黄金蝶别针，加以了鼓励。

Umineko Project (UP): Giving up means that you have zero chance of success.
Steam (ST): Giving up means that you've got zero chance of success.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Giving up means that you have zero chance of success.
PC Japanese (JP): 諦めるということは、確率ゼロということ。
Russian (RU): Если сдаёшься, шансов на успех ноль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Desistir significa que suas chances de sucesso são zero.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所謂放棄，即是概率為零。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所谓放弃，即是概率为零。

Umineko Project (UP): But if, with the power of magic, you think there just might be some chance of your wish coming true, the probability then rises to something greater than zero at the very least.
Steam (ST): However, if the power of magic makes you think there might be some chance of your wish coming true, then the odds of it happening are at least greater than zero.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, with the power of magic, if you think that there just might be some chance of your wish coming true, the odds of it happening are greater than zero, at the very least.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、魔法の力で、ひょっとしたら叶うかもしれないと思えば、確率は、少なくともゼロよりは高くなる。
Russian (RU): Однако с силой магии, если думаешь, что желание может сбыться, шансы на успех, по крайней мере, поднимаются выше нуля.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, se com o poder da magia, você acha que pode ter alguma chance de realizar seu desejo, isso provavelmente aumenta suas chances para algo ligeiramente acima do zero.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，只要她在想著或許通過魔法的力量能實現心願，實現夢想的概率，就至少是要比零高。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，只要她在想着或许通过魔法的力量能实现心愿，实现梦想的概率，就至少是要比零高。

Umineko Project (UP): Zero remains zero forever, but if even a faint probability were to exist, ......it would be no exaggeration to say that an impossible miracle had occurred, compared to the time when the probability was zero.
Steam (ST): Zero remains zero forever, so "miracle" is a fitting word to describe even a faint chance coming into existence. Humans can use magic to defeat "resignation",
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Zero remains zero forever, but if even a faint probability exists, ......it would be no exaggeration to say that a miracle had occurred since the time that probability had been zero. Humans can use magic to take 'resignation',
PC Japanese (JP): ゼロは永遠にゼロだが、ほんのわずかでも確率が存在するなら、……ゼロの時と比べれば、あり得ない奇跡が起こったと言っても過言ではないだろう。
Russian (RU): Ноль всегда останется нулём, но если есть хотя бы слабая вероятность...... не будет преувеличением сказать, что случилось чудо, раз шансы равнялись нулю.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Zero permanece sendo zero para sempre, mas se uma fraca probabilidade existir, ......não seria exagero dizer que um milagre impossível ocorreu, comparado com a época em que a probabilidade era zero.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 零永遠是零，但如果是存在著微小的一點點概率，……那這與是零時相比，稱其為發生了不可能的奇跡都不算言過其實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 零永远是零，但如果是存在着微小的一点点概率，……那这与是零时相比，称其为发生了不可能的奇迹都不算言过其实。

Umineko Project (UP): Humans can use magic to take "resignation", by which they themselves make the probability of success zero, and cancel it out.
Steam (ST): the process by which they themselves make their probability of success zero.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): by which they themselves make the probability of success zero, and cancel it out.
PC Japanese (JP): ニンゲンが、自ら確率をゼロに閉ざす“諦め”を、魔法によってそこだけを取り除く。
Russian (RU): Люди могут использовать магию для 'отторжения', когда сами же обращают вероятность успеха в ноль и отменяют его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Humanos podem usar a magia para aceitar a "resignação", a qual eles próprios fazem com a probabilidade de sucesso seja zero, e cancelá‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 通過魔法是只能去除，人類自行將概率封閉為零的“放棄”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 通过魔法是只能去除，人类自行将概率封闭为零的“放弃”。

Umineko Project (UP): When a {y:0:Human}{n:0:human} does not give up, though their chances of success may be small, those chances do exist.
Steam (ST): When a Human refuses to give up, though their chances of success may be small, those chances do exist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When a human does not give up, though their chances of success may be small, those chances do exist.
PC Japanese (JP): 諦めないニンゲンには、どんなにわずかであっても、達する可能性がある。
Russian (RU): Когда {y:0:Челове}{n:0:челове}к не сдаётся, даже если шансы на успех небольшие, они есть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando um {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano} não desiste, mesmo com suas chances de sucesso sendo mínimas, essa chance ainda existe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不會放棄的人類，無論希望多渺茫，都是有成功的可能性的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不会放弃的人类，无论希望多渺茫，都是有成功的可能性的。

Umineko Project (UP): And the stronger their belief, the more those odds rise.
Steam (ST): And the more determined they become, the greater those odds rise.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And the more determined they become, the greater those odds rise.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてそれは、確信すればするほど、高くなる。
Russian (RU): Чем решительнее становишься, тем выше вероятность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E quanto mais forte eles acreditarem nela, maiores se tornam as probabilidades.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並且這個是，越是堅信，成功率越高。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且这个是，越是坚信，成功率越高。

Umineko Project (UP): It was easy to imagine that Shannon had made earnest wishes upon the brooch, believed in its effect, ......and made many little efforts to get George to like her.
Steam (ST): It was easy to imagine Shannon making earnest wishes upon that brooch, believing in its effect, ...and trying little things over and over again to get George to like her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was easy to imagine that Shannon had made earnest wishes upon the brooch, believed in its effect, ......and tried little things over and over again to get George to like her.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音が黄金蝶のブローチに強く願い、その効果を確信し、……譲治に気に入られるために、小さな努力を積み重ねただろうことは、想像に難くない。
Russian (RU): Легко представить, что Шаннон вложила в брошь серьёзные желания, веря в её эффект...... и постепенно завоёвывала любовь Джорджа.

Umineko Project (UP): It grew more brilliant still, shining like the sun.

Russian (RU): Блеск стал ещё ярче, сияя словно солнце.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi ficando cada vez mais brilhante, reluzindo como o Sol.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 光还在越变越强，宛如太阳般地耀眼。

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica didn't need Kanon to tell her to put her hands over her eyes......

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica didn't need Kanon to tell her to put her hands over her eyes......
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音に言われずとも、朱志香は自分の目を両手で覆わざるを得なかった……。
Russian (RU): Чтобы закрыть глаза руками, Джессика не нуждалась в предупреждении Канона......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica não precisava que Kanon dissesse para ela cobrir seus olhos com as mãos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就算沒嘉音說，朱志香也只能去用雙手擋住自己的雙眼……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就算没嘉音说，朱志香也只能去用双手挡住自己的双眼……。

Umineko Project (UP): As the light grew stronger, ......a sound like the roaring of the wind or the tide also grew in intensity.
Steam (ST): As the light grew stronger, ...a sound like the roar of the wind or the tide also grew in intensity.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the light grew stronger, ......a sound like the roar of the wind or the tide also grew in intensity.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Conforme a luz se fortalecia, ......um som similar ao rugido do vento ou talvez da maré, ficava cada vez mais intenso.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着光越变越强，……风或潮水般的呼啸之音也是越来越大声。

Steam (ST): The sound of the wind and rain outside had already been overwhelmed...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The sound of the wind and rain outside had already been overwhelmed...

Russian (RU): Шум ветра и дождя снаружи уже был заглушён...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele já havia abafado por completo o som do vento e da chuva que caía do lado de fora...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 已是，把屋外的風雨之音都給吞沒了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 已是，把屋外的风雨之音都给吞没了…。

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica could no longer even stand, and she crouched on the floor......
Steam (ST): Jessica could no longer even stand, and she crouched on the floor...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica could no longer even stand, and she crouched on the floor......

Russian (RU): Джессика, которая теперь даже не могла стоять, присела на пол......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica não conseguia mais suportar, e acabou se agachando no chão......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香连站都站不住了，不禁蹲下了身子……。

Umineko Project (UP): It was a flood of sound and light... And until it withdrew, Jessica could do nothing but moan......
Steam (ST): A flood of sound and light... Until it withdrew, Jessica could do nothing but moan...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A flood of sound and light... Until it withdrew, Jessica could do nothing but moan......
PC Japanese (JP): 光と音の洪水…。それが引くまで、朱志香は呻くことしか出来なかった……。
Russian (RU): Пока поток звука и света не отступил... она могла только стонать......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era uma inundação de som e luz... E até que aquilo findasse, Jessica não conseguiu fazer nada mais além de gemer......
